precontext: The night sky was full of bright lights. Many gathered in the field with their telescopes and cameras ready. Everyone was hoping for a glimpse of something spectacular.
sentence: It was clear which one was the outstanding star.
ending: When the spotlight hit the lead actress stepping onto the makeshift outdoor set, the entire crew fell silent in admiration.
meanings_considered: (astronomy) a celestial body of hot gases that radiates energy derived from thermonuclear reactions in the interior
an actor who plays a principal role
explanation:
• The precontext describing "bright lights" in the night sky strongly supports the astronomical meaning of "star" as a celestial body.  
• The phrase "outstanding star" in the sentence, combined with the mention of performance and a lead actress, strongly suggests the actor meaning, as "star" in this context refers to a prominent performer.  
• The ending explicitly confirms the actor meaning by referring to "the lead actress" and "spotlight," which directly ties "star" to the role of a performer, ruling out the astronomical interpretation.
